question: 著しい
sourceMnemonic: The kanji means <kanji>author</kanji>, but if you think about it, what do authors do? They write about <vocabulary>remarkable</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>marked</vocabulary> things, whether it's fiction or nonfiction.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Something is so <vocabulary>remarkable</vocabulary> you let out <reading>one jeer</reading> (<ja>いちじる</ja>) at the opposing team. Just one, because you're not that mean.
